Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): BIOL 1F25
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Biology: A Human Perspective

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Contemporary issues of human concern; genetics and biology of cancer and obesity; learning, memory and addiction.
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): BIOL 1P23

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Cancer: A Human Perspective
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Contemporary issues concerning cancer in people. Topics may include cancer incidence, properties of cancerous and non-cancerous cells, discovery of genes that contribute to cancer, how genes contribute to cancer, inherited predisposition to cancer and environmental factors contributing to cancer incidence.

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): BIOL 1P24
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Learning and Memory: A Human Perspective

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Contemporary issues of the brain and central nervous system in people with a specific focus on learning and memory. Topics may include electrical properties of brain cells, how brain cells communicate with one another, how synapses in the brain change during learning and memory, links between learning and memory and drug abuse and synaptic changes in various neurodegenerative diseases.
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): BIOL 1P27

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Human Impact on Ecosystem Imbalances
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Current issues illustrating human impact and environmental consequences. Topics may include dynamic nature of biochemical cycles, ecosystem energetics and ecosystem imbalances.

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): BIOL 1P28
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Human Impact on Environmental Sustainability

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Current issues illustrating human impact on the environment. Topics may include climate change, GMO food sources, acid rain and bio-remediation.
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): BIOL 1P91

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Introduction to Biology I
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Chemical basis of life, macromolecules, membrane structure, biological energy conversion, nucleic acid structure and DNA replication, gene expression and genetics.

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): BIOL 1P92
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Introduction to Biology II

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): BIOL 1P96
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Fundamental Skills in Biological Sciences

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Practical skills for higher education. Scientific method, literature research methods, effective communication (oral and written) and math and biostatistic skills.
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Prerequisite(s): SBI4U and MFH4U.

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Note: this course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): BIOL 2P02

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Introduction to Molecular Biology
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Chemical foundations of life, nucleic acids and protein structure and function, techniques for studying macromolecules in cells and tissues, genome structure and evolution, basic molecular genetic mechanisms, eukaryotic gene structure and expression, and bioinformatics.

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Restriction: students must have a minimum of 3.0 overall credits.
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Note: materials fee required. This course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): BIOL 2P03
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Cell Biology

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Structure, function and interactions of cells of eukaryotes. Membrane structure and transmembrane transport, vesicular traffic and secretion, the cytoskeleton, signal transduction, factors affecting cell shape, movement and adhesion, the cell cycle, and stem cells. Emphasis on these processes in embryonic cells as well as in specialized cell types of the immune and nervous systems.
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Restriction: students must have a minimum of 3.0 overall credits.

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Note: materials fee required. This course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): BIOL 2P05

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Evolution
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): The origins and history of life. Evolutionary mechanisms, especially natural selection. Phenotypic and genotypic variation among individuals and related population- and species-level patterns. Population genetics, phenotypic plasticity, life history strategies, molecular evolution, developmental genetics (evo-devo).

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Restriction: students must have a minimum of 3.0 overall credits.
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Note: this course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): BIOL 2P92
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Principles of Zoology

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Introduction to animal diversity and the basic body plans of phyla within the animal kingdom. Relationships of structures to such functions as movement, feeding, respiration and development. Evolutionary series illustrated where appropriate.
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Restriction: students must have a minimum of 3.0 overall credits.

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Note: materials fee required. This course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): BIOL 2P93

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Introduction to Botany
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Principles of plant taxonomy, morphology, reproduction and development. Strategies employed by plants in the resolution of habitat limitations and range expansion.

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Restriction: students must have a minimum of 3.0 overall credits.
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Note: this course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): BIOL 2P94
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Plant Biology: Growth and Development

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Restriction: students must have a minimum of 3.0 overall credits.
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Note: materials fee required. This course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): #BIOL 2P95
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Bioethics

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Value conflicts and moral dilemmas in biology and medicine. Emphasis on specific case studies in reproductive interventions, medical experimentation, concepts of "health" and "disease", modification of behaviour, lifestyle choices, allocation of scarce or expensive medical resources, and death and dying.
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Note: may count as an elective, but not as a major credit in an Honours BIOL (single or combined) program. This course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): BIOL 2P96
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Biology of Fungi

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Structure, development, metabolism, reproduction and evolution of fungi, emphasizing the importance of fungi, in particular yeasts, to industrial processes.
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Restriction: students must have a minimum of 3.0 overall credits.

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Note: materials fee required. This course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): BIOL 2P97

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Human Physiology
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Normal human function with specific reference to digestive, circulatory, respiratory and excretory activities and their regulation as well as their more common genetic, environmental and lifestyle pathologies.

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Restriction: students must have a minimum of 3.0 overall credits.
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Note: this course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): BIOL 2P98
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Principles of Microbiology

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Diversity, evolution, physiology and genetics of micro-organisms emphasizing applied, medical and environmental microbiology.
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Restriction: students must have a minimum of 3.0 overall credits.

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Note: materials fee required. This course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): BIOL 2Q04

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Principles of Ecology
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Ecological processes at the population, community and ecosystem levels of biological organization; mathematical models of population growth, predation and competition; factors influencing community structure, landscapes, biodiversity and ecosystems.

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Restriction: students must have a minimum of 3.0 overall credits.
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): #BIOL 3P03

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Paleontology and Paleobiology
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Biodiversity and ecosystems through geologic time, micro and macro evolution in paleobiology and evolutionary biology, large scale environmental change and the fossil record, functional morphology, and phylogenetic and cladistic analysis of the fossil record.

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Note: this course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): BIOL 3P28

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Developmental Biology
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Principles of vertebrate and invertebrate development. Topics include life cycles and the evolution of developmental patterns; the genetic core of development; differential gene expression; cell-cell communication; fertilization; early development and axial specification in selected vertebrates and invertebrates.

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Note: materials fee required. This course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): BIOL 3P30

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Cell Physiology
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Molecular physiology of non-excitable membranes, mechanisms of cellular response and adaptation, control and regulation of cell metabolism; molecular basis of cellular dysfunction in human aging and disease.

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Note: this course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): *BIOL 3P34

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Neurobiology
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Structure and function of nerve cells: Electrical properties of neurons, synaptic function and transmitters, neural plasticity and cellular basis of behaviour.

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Applied Microbiology
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Ecology of micro-organisms and special adaptations that permit their use in biotechnology and applied microbiology.

Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): *BIOL 3P50

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Molecular Genetics
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Topics include the genetic code and information flow from nucleic acids to proteins, RNA and protein synthesis; prokaryotic and eukaryotic chromosomes; gene organization; transcription, RNA processing; codon usage; enhancer and transposons.

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Note: materials fee required. This course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): *BIOL 3P51

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Principles of Genetic Inheritance
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Concepts of classical genetics including Mendelian inheritance,  genetic mapping, extra-nuclear inheritance, chromosome transmission, polyploidy and population genetics.

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Restriction: students must have a minimum of 8.0 overall credits.
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Note: materials fee required. This course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): BIOL 3P60
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Animal Behaviour

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Social context of behaviour and natural selection: the evolution and significance of visual, auditory and olfactory communication; spacing behaviour and the evolution of diversity in spacing systems; mating systems and sexual selection; development of species-typical behaviour; the development and significance of periodic behaviour patterns including endogenous rhythms orientation and navigation.
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Note: materials fee required. This course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): BIOL 3P64
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Introductory Insect Biology

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Field and laboratory exercises and lectures covering morphology, physiology, evolution, ecology, social behaviour and harmful and beneficial aspects of the insects.

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Inter-university selections from the offerings of the Ontario Universities Program in Field Biology.

Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): BIOL 3P72

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Ontario Universities Field Ecology Course
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Restriction: students must have a minimum of 8.0 overall credits and permission of the course co-ordinator.

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Note: takes place at different field sites from May through August for 1 or 2 weeks durations. Registrants must submit an application with the course co-ordinator by the end of January. See course co-ordinator for application. Students are expected to pay their own expenses. Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): #BIOL 3P85

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Ecology of a Changing Planet
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Impact of environmental change and human activity on ecosystems. Topics include climate change and global warming, habitat fragmentation, extinction, invasive species, conservation biology and the management of ecological integrity.

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Note: this course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): *BIOL 3P90

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Investigative Neurobiology
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Methods used in neurobiology and neurophysiology. Electro-physiological techniques, including intracellular and extracellular recording from nerve cells and muscle, and on theory and techniques for electro-physiological data acquisition. Other topics include intracellular staining, immunocytochemistry and assay procedures.

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): BIOL 3P91
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Plant Physiology: Metabolic and Biophysical Processes

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Metabolism of carbon and nitrogen compounds; photosynthetic and respiratory processes; mineral nutrition; water relations; gas exchange and transport processes.
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Note: materials fee required. This course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): BIOL 3P92
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Advanced Developmental Biology

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Post-embryonic development, metamorphosis, regeneration and aging, plant development, medical implications of developmental biology, environmental regulation of development, and developmental mechanisms of evolutionary change.
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Note: this course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): BIOL 3P93
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Histology

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Introduction to microscopy and histologic specimen preparation. Emphasis on the simulated microscopic examination of epithelial cell types, connective tissue, muscular tissue, nervous tissue and tissues of the gastrointestinal, respiratory, endocrine, and lymphatic systems in humans and other vertebrates.
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): BIOL 3P95

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Comparative Animal Physiology
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): How animals work, survive and regulate physiological processes emphasizing energetics. Homeostatic mechanisms of respiration, circulation, osmoregulation, thermoregulation, locomotion and metabolism in vertebrates with select comparisons.

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Note: materials fee required. This course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): BIOL 3P96

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Biometrics
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Introduction to the principles of experimental design and data analysis. Emphasis on practice in research planning, sampling, data collection, analyzing and interpreting biological data from a variety of different fields (molecular biology, physiology, neurobiology, ecology).

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): BIOL 3P97
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Molecular Ecology

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Review of population genetics and the use of molecular markers; the application of molecular genetic data to issues and problems in evolutionary biology, population genetics, and animal behaviour, including phylogenetics, kinship and population subdivision.
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Note: this course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): #BIOL 3P98
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Wine Microbiology

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Identification and enumeration of indigenous micro-organisms in grape must. Alcoholic fermentation; metabolism of nitrogen compounds and organic acids; production of sulphur compounds; killer yeasts; malolactic fermentation; wine spoilage micro-organisms; genetic improvement of wine yeasts.
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): BIOL 3P99

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Medical and Veterinary Entomology
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Identification, behavioural ecology, evolution, and disease relationships of arthropods affecting the health of humans and domestic animals. Examination of empirical studies in the current literature.

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Note: this course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): BIOL 4F90

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Honours Thesis
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Each student will undertake a limited research project involving field or laboratory study under faculty supervision.

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): BIOL 4F91
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Literature Research and Seminar

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Each student will undertake a detailed study of the scientific literature relevant to the topic of the honours thesis.
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): BIOL 4F92

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Library Research Essays
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Each student will be required to carry out two detailed studies of the scientific literature under faculty supervision.

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Note: results of the studies will be presented in major essays and formal seminars. One research topic is to be completed each term. This course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): #BIOL 4P03

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Current Topics in Photobiology
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): The interaction of light with biological molecules. Effects of ultraviolet radiation, photosynthesis, vision and photoregulation of genes and proteins.

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Note: this course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): BIOL 4P05

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Concepts of Biodiversity in a Biosphere Reserve
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Issues of ecosystem survey and long-term monitoring of changes due to human activities and environmental factors (natural and anthropogenic). Examination of natural versus urban ecosystems based on integrative studies from the biological, geological, geographical, management, social and economic perspectives.

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): *BIOL 4P06
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Bioinformatics

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Sequence analysis, phylogeny, databases and tools, functional genomics, genome projects, basic bioinformatics programming.
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Restriction: students must have a minimum of 14.0 overall credits or approval to year 4 (honours).

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): #BIOL 4P08
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Topics in Plant and Microbial Biotechnology

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Characterization of biochemical processes and structures. Genetic modification of such processes and structures through molecular manipulation to meet scientific and/or societal needs. Examples include yeast and microbial enzymes or enzyme systems as well as crop proteins and enzymes.
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Note: this course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): BIOL 4P10
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Microbial Pathogenesis

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): A molecular approach to microbial diseases in a variety of hosts focusing on human diseases. Topics include animal models for diseases, molecular diagnostics, identifying virulence factors and population genetics of pathogenic microbes.
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Note: this course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): *BIOL 4P11
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Theory of Techniques in Biochemistry and Molecular Biology

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Theory behind basic and some advanced techniques in nucleic acid and protein manipulations and analysis.
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Note: this course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): BIOL 4P13
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Bioenergetics

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Exploration of the molecular basis of cellular energy transduction. Topics may include biogenesis of mitochondria, assembly and function of respiratory complexes, mitochondrial signaling and apoptosis, and methodological approaches to studying cellular energetics.
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Note: this course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): #BIOL 4P18
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Paleobotany and Palynology

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Fossil record of the green lineage: chlorophytes, charophytes and embryophytes. Evolution of the clade Viridiplantae. Record of terrestrialization and of plant interactions with fungi and animals. Reconstruction of paleoenvironments and paleoclimates from paleobotanical evidence.
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): *BIOL 4P20

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Synthetic Biology
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Technological and engineering advances in the biological sciences, along with tools and discoveries stemming from them. Induced pluripotent stem cells, CRISPR/Cas9-based genome editing, optogenetic control of cellular communication, engineering the immune response, programmable DNA-based materials and engineered biosensors.

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Note: this course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): *BIOL 4P25

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Concepts in Bioremediation and Biocommodities
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Waste-management technologies that utilize biological agents (such as micro-organisms and plants) to treat hazardous contaminants and produce biocommodities. Biological, biogeochemical and engineering concepts in the design of technologies.

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Prerequisite(s): only open to students holding 15 or more credits.
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): #BIOL 4P26

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Stream Form and Function
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Exploration of the physical, chemical and biological characteristics of stream systems.

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Note: this course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): BIOL 4P28

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Developmental Neurobiology
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Principles of neural development. Topics include cell lineage and early determinative events, trophic functions, growth and plasticity, synaptogenesis and gene expression in the establishment of the nervous system.

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Note: this course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): #BIOL 4P30

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Grape Pest Management
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Biology and dynamics of grapevine pest activity - insects, diseases, weeds, nematodes, vertebrates. Integrated pest management approach looking at all aspects of control chemical, biological, cultural. Application techniques, pest identification and monitoring.

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Note: field trip fee required. This course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): BIOL 4P34

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Neural Networks and Behaviour
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Integrative mechanisms in the nervous system and the neural basis of behaviour in vertebrates and invertebrates. Topics may include the visual system, rhythm generators and motor function, learning and memory.

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Note: this course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): BIOL 4P35

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Biology of Sensory Systems
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Analysis of the anatomy, physiology, molecular and cellular mechanisms of sensory biology incorporating a neuroethological approach to behavioural processes in animals.  Emphasis on the comparative biology of olfaction, gustation, vision, mechanosensation, thermal sensation, nociception, and chemosensation and magnetoception.

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): *BIOL 4P41
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Human Molecular Genetics

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Principles of human genetics, human genome organization, pedigree, disease gene mapping, forensic and cancer genetics, genome sequencing, personal genomics.
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Restriction: students must have a minimum of 14.0 overall credits or approval to year 4 (honours).

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Note: this course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): *BIOL 4P42

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): RNA World
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Examination of various aspects of RNA (ribonucleic acid) function and evolution. Examination of evidence that RNA preceded DNA as the hereditary material and played a crucial role in the early evolution of life on Earth.

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Note: this course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): BIOL 4P43

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Biology of Aging
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Exploration of current theories of animal aging. Investigation of molecular and cellular mechanisms of aging and determinants of longevity. Examination of age-associated human disorders

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Note: this course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): *BIOL 4P51

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Molecular Virology
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Bacterial and animal viruses. Topics include biochemical properties, virus-host interaction, productive cycle, effect of virus on host cell and organism, viral vectors and gene therapy, recombinant viral vaccines and origin of virus.

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Note: this course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): BIOL 4P53

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Immunology
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): Humoral and cellular immunity; structure and synthesis of immunoglobulins; origin of antibody diversity; transplantation immunity and the importance of the major histocompatibility complex; auto-immunity and allergic reactions.

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Note: this course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.
Jeff Stuart (as of January 2022): BIOL 4P56

Fiona Hunter (until December 31, 2021): Genes and Behaviour
